FAQ.question: What is Jamabandi (Agriculture)?
FAQ.answer: Jamabandi is an official revenue record (also called the Record of Rights) that lists ownership, land extent, cultivation, and revenue liabilities for agricultural land.

FAQ.question: Why is Jamabandi important?
FAQ.answer: It is used to verify ownership, apply for agricultural loans and subsidies, resolve revenue disputes, and confirm cultivation and land classification.

FAQ.question: What details are required to obtain Jamabandi?
FAQ.answer: You need the district, tehsil, village, survey/resurvey number, sub-division (if any), and owner/khata details.

FAQ.question: How long does it take to get Jamabandi?
FAQ.answer: If records are digitized it can be accessed instantly; otherwise, it may take 1â€“2 working days depending on record retrieval.

FAQ.question: What information does Jamabandi contain?
FAQ.answer: It contains owner name, khata/tenant details, land extent, cultivation information, any government or bank liabilities, and revenue entries for the plot.
